Pre-Game Insights: Cleveland went 8-0, first in the Eastern Conference, while New Orleans was 3-5, 14th in the Western Conference.
New Orleans averaged 8.3 steals, 4.6 blocks, and 12.4 turnovers per game last season.
Cleveland allowed opponents to score 110.2 points per game and shoot 46.3% from the field last season.

Pelicans injuries include Trey Murphy III (hamstring), Jordan Hawkins (back), CJ McCollum (adductor), Herbert Jones (shoulder), and Dejounte Murray (hand); Cavaliers injuries include Dean Wade (illness), Caris LeVert (knee), Emoni Bates (knee), Max Strus (ankle), and Jaylon Tyson (hip).
